sentence.content: NEGOTIATIONS FOR a new contract between Botswana, the world&apost;s most important diamond producer in value terms, and De Beers, the South African group which controls 80 per cent of the market for rough (uncut) diamonds, are taking much longer than expected.

sentence.content: If Botswana were to sell 10 per cent of its rough diamond production, worth about USDollars 100m, independently of the CSO - which sells about Dollars 4bn-worth a year from all over the world - it would represent no threat to market stability, IDC said.

sentence.content: However, the &apost;market window&apost; idea is unlikely to be dropped and will almost certainly be raised again when the next contract negotiations start.

mention.string: De Beers , which itself mines about 40 per cent of the world's annual rough diamond output , markets stones from Angola , Australia , Namibia , Tanzania , Zaire and the Soviet Union , as well as South Africa and Botswana .
